definitions: large passenger ship designed for regular ocean voyages
protective or decorative material covering the inside of something
cosmetic pencil used to outline eyes or lips
examples: The ocean liner departed from Southampton with thousands aboard
They booked passage on a luxury liner for their anniversary cruise
The jacket's silk liner keeps you warm without adding bulk
Replace the bin liner when you empty the trash
She applied black liner to define her eyes dramatically
The makeup artist used nude liner before applying lipstick

definitions: assistant referee who monitors sidelines and offside positions in sports
person who installs and repairs electrical or telephone lines
examples: The linesman raised his flag to signal an offside violation
Both linesmen must agree before the goal can be disallowed
The linesman worked through the storm restoring power connections
Call the utility company to send a linesman for repairs

definitions: arrangement of people or things in a row or sequence
scheduled list of performers, events, or programs
police procedure where suspects stand together for witness identification
examples: The team's starting lineup included three new players this season
Fans waited hours to see the festival's impressive lineup
Tonight's television lineup features several award-winning documentaries
The conference lineup includes speakers from multiple industries
The witness identified the suspect from the police lineup immediately
They assembled a lineup of six similar-looking individuals

definitions: women's underwear and nightwear, typically made from delicate fabrics
examples: She bought silk lingerie for her honeymoon trousseau
The boutique specializes in luxury lingerie and intimate apparel

definitions: act or state of remaining present longer than expected or desired
examples: The lingering of guests made cleanup impossible until midnight
His lingering at the doorway suggested he had more to say

definitions: informal term for specialized vocabulary used by a particular group
examples: Medical students quickly learn the lingo of their profession
The startup world has its own lingo that outsiders find confusing

definitions: person who studies language scientifically or speaks multiple languages fluently
examples: The linguist analyzed the structure of endangered indigenous languages
They hired a linguist to help develop their translation software

definitions: material used to cover the inner surface of something
act of forming or arranging things in a line
examples: The coat's wool lining provides extra warmth in winter
Silver lining in storm clouds creates a beautiful effect
The lining of books on shelves took hours to complete
Careful lining of ingredients ensures even cooking results

definitions: thing or relationship that connects two or more elements
single ring or loop in a chain
clickable connection to a webpage or digital resource
examples: Scientists discovered a link between diet and heart disease
The missing link in the investigation was finally found
The chain broke at its weakest link during lifting
Each link must be inspected for signs of wear
Click this link to access the registration form online
The broken link led to an error page instead

definitions: system or instance of connections between things or concepts
mechanical system of rods or levers connected to transmit motion
examples: The linkage between education and income is well documented
Genetic linkage determines how traits are inherited together
The steering linkage needed adjustment after hitting the pothole
Complex linkage systems control the robot's precise movements

definitions: informal term for linoleum floor covering material
examples: The kitchen lino needs replacing after twenty years
They chose patterned lino for the bathroom renovation

definitions: durable floor covering made from linseed oil, cork dust, and other materials
examples: The vintage linoleum flooring features geometric patterns from the fifties
Hospital corridors often use linoleum for easy maintenance

definitions: seed of the flax plant used to produce oil and animal feed
examples: Artists mix linseed oil with pigments to create oil paints
The horses' feed contains linseed for a glossy coat

definitions: short fine fibers that separate from cloth or yarn
examples: Remove lint from the dryer filter after each load
His dark suit showed every bit of white lint

definitions: horizontal support beam above a door or window opening
examples: The stone lintel bears the weight of the wall above
Ancient temples feature decorated lintels with religious symbols

definitions: large tawny-colored cat native to Africa and India
person showing exceptional courage or strength
symbol used in heraldry representing courage and nobility
examples: The lion stalked through the savanna grass hunting zebra
A pride of lions rested under the acacia tree
She was a lion in battle, fearless and determined
He fought like a lion to protect his family
The royal coat of arms features a golden lion
Three lions appear on the English football team's badge

definitions: either of the two fleshy parts forming the edges of the mouth
edge or rim of a container, cavity, or other opening
examples: She applied balm to her chapped lips before going outside
His lips trembled as he tried to speak
Pour carefully over the lip of the measuring cup
The crater's lip rises hundreds of feet above ground

definitions: colored cosmetic applied to lips for color and protection
examples: She chose red lipstick to complement her evening dress
The lipstick's formula includes moisturizing ingredients

definitions: sweet alcoholic drink made from distilled spirits and added flavors
examples: They served coffee liqueur after the formal dinner
The bartender added orange liqueur to the cocktail

definitions: substance that flows freely like water, having consistent volume but no fixed shape
asset easily converted to cash without significant loss of value
examples: Water and oil are liquids with different densities
The liquid medicine tastes better when mixed with juice
Keep some liquid assets available for emergency expenses
Stocks are more liquid than real estate investments

definitions: process of closing a business and selling its assets to pay debts
conversion of assets into cash through sale or disposal
examples: The company entered liquidation after years of losses
Creditors received partial payment through the liquidation process
The estate liquidation raised funds for the beneficiaries
Inventory liquidation offers deep discounts to clear stock

definitions: person appointed to wind up affairs of a company entering liquidation
examples: The court appointed a liquidator to oversee asset distribution
The liquidator must act in creditors' best interests

definitions: availability of liquid assets or ability to convert assets to cash
degree to which an asset can be quickly bought or sold
examples: The bank maintains high liquidity to meet withdrawal demands
Poor liquidity forced them to sell assets below value
Market liquidity affects how easily shares can be traded
Bond liquidity varies depending on credit rating

definitions: distilled alcoholic drink such as whiskey, vodka, or rum
liquid produced by cooking food, especially seafood or vegetables
examples: The bar stocks premium liquor brands from around the world
State laws regulate liquor sales and distribution
Save the oyster liquor to flavor the sauce
The pot liquor from greens contains valuable nutrients

definitions: sweet black substance extracted from the root of a Mediterranean plant
candy or flavoring made from or tasting like liquorice root
examples: Traditional medicine uses liquorice root for digestive issues
The distinctive taste of liquorice comes from glycyrrhizin
Children either love or hate black liquorice candy
She chose liquorice allsorts from the sweet shop

definitions: former basic monetary unit of Italy and currently of Turkey
examples: The price was listed in Turkish lira at the Istanbul market
Italy replaced the lira with the euro in 2002

definitions: speech defect or manner where 's' sounds are pronounced like 'th'
examples: The child's lisp made 'sister' sound like 'thithter'
Speech therapy helped reduce her noticeable lisp

definitions: number of connected items or names written or printed consecutively
tilting to one side of a ship or vessel
examples: The grocery list included milk, bread, and eggs
She made a list of tasks to complete today
The ship developed a dangerous list after taking water
A sudden list to starboard alarmed the passengers

definitions: person who listens, especially attentively or to radio broadcasts
examples: A good therapist must be an active listener
Radio listeners called in to share their opinions

definitions: number or demographic of people who listen to a radio program
examples: The morning show's listenership increased by twenty percent
Advertisers pay based on the program's listenership demographics

definitions: action of paying attention to sound or someone speaking
examples: Active listening improves communication in relationships
The listening exercise tested students' comprehension skills

definitions: person who compiles or maintains lists of information
examples: The bird lister recorded every species seen that day
Property listers evaluate homes for tax assessment purposes

definitions: display of items or information in list form
property or item advertised for sale or rent
examples: The directory listing shows all available phone numbers
Check the listing of ingredients for allergens
The real estate listing attracted multiple offers immediately
Her listing appeared on several property websites

definitions: informal abbreviation for literature as an academic subject
examples: She majored in English lit at university
The lit class analyzed Victorian novels this semester

definitions: series of petitions used in church services with fixed responses
tedious recital or repetitive series of complaints or problems
examples: The congregation responded to each line of the litany
Ancient litanies date back to early Christian worship
He recited a litany of complaints about the service
The report contained a litany of safety violations

definitions: metric unit of capacity equal to one thousand cubic centimeters
examples: The recipe calls for two liters of water
Gas prices are shown per liter in most countries

definitions: ability to read and write at a functional level
competence or knowledge in a specified area
examples: Adult literacy programs help people gain essential skills
The country's literacy rate exceeds ninety percent
Digital literacy is essential in today's workplace
Financial literacy helps people make better money decisions

definitions: taking words in their usual or most basic sense without metaphor
examples: The literal meaning differs from the figurative interpretation
She took his joking comment in a literal sense

definitions: person able to read and write or having knowledge in a specific field
examples: Computer literates have advantages in the job market
The program aims to make all citizens literate

definitions: well-educated people interested in literature and the arts
examples: The city's literati gathered at the book launch party
Café discussions among literati shaped cultural movements

definitions: written works considered to have artistic or intellectual value
printed material on a particular subject
examples: She studied English literature focusing on romantic poetry
Nobel prizes recognize excellence in world literature
The doctor provided literature about managing diabetes
Marketing literature explains the product's features clearly

definitions: soft silver-white metal that is the lightest solid element
medication containing lithium salts used to treat bipolar disorder
examples: Lithium batteries power many electronic devices today
The element lithium reacts vigorously with water
The psychiatrist prescribed lithium for mood stabilization
Regular blood tests monitor lithium levels in patients

definitions: print made by lithography process from a stone or metal plate
examples: The museum displayed original lithographs by famous artists
Collectors value signed lithographs more than reproductions

definitions: printing process using flat stone or metal plate with greasy image
examples: Modern lithography produces high-quality commercial printing
The artist learned traditional lithography techniques

definitions: rigid outer layer of earth consisting of crust and upper mantle
examples: Tectonic plates form part of the earth's lithosphere
The lithosphere floats on the semi-fluid asthenosphere below

definitions: person involved in a lawsuit as plaintiff or defendant
examples: Both litigants agreed to settle out of court
The litigant presented evidence supporting their claim

definitions: process of taking legal action or conducting a lawsuit
examples: The litigation lasted three years before reaching settlement
Companies try to avoid costly litigation when possible

definitions: lawyer who specializes in taking legal action and representing clients in court
examples: The experienced litigator won most of her cases
Corporate litigators handle complex business disputes

definitions: metric unit of capacity equal to one thousand cubic centimeters
examples: Buy two litres of milk from the store
The engine has a three litre capacity

definitions: rubbish or waste material left lying in public places
absorbent material for animals to urinate and defecate in
group of young animals born to one mother at one time
examples: Volunteers collected litter from the beach yesterday
Heavy fines discourage people from dropping litter
Change the cat litter box twice a week
Pine litter provides natural odor control
The dog had a litter of seven healthy puppies
Only three kittens survived from the litter
